item.title: Accessing the configuration repo
item.description: You have created an EKS cluster, installed Flux v2 in it, and created a repo that holds manifests matching precisely the current state of your cluster -and you did all that with one command, pretty cool right!. In order to manage your cluster as well as deploy workloads you will need to clone the repo that Flux v2 created in your GitHub account. Flux created and configured a key pair for the repository automatically, and uses it to provide repository access to the Source Controller running in the cluster.

item.title: Managing configuration with GitOps
